intro: Erigeron taylorii, commonly known as Taylor's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with white ray florets, and bloom during the summer months. Erigeron taylorii is a perennial herb that has adapted to arid environments through its deep root system and drought-resistant foliage.
